Title: "A Comprehensive Review of Logic Programming for Knowledge Representation and Reasoning"

Abstract:
This paper provides a comprehensive review of logic programming as a knowledge representation and reasoning paradigm. It covers the fundamental concepts of logic programming, including the syntax and semantics of logic programs, as well as the various knowledge representation formalisms that can be used in conjunction with logic programming, such as conceptual graphs and ontology engineering. The paper also discusses the strengths and weaknesses of logic programming in comparison to other knowledge representation and reasoning paradigms, and highlights the current state of the art in the field. Finally, the paper provides a roadmap for future research in logic programming, including areas such as the integration of logic programming with machine learning and the development of more efficient and scalable implementations of logic programming systems.
